[Tech Enabler] Update Logging Framework Version - CM/CC,MOBPXD-1063,1291274,Story,Analysis,MOBPXD,Mobi Super Product,software,Crystal Chapman,712020:2305961c-4962-4646-9b4b-a0320002081b,,Not Set,,Swathi Garapati,6086df09bb0b0500704d4f0e,Nathaniel Fickel,5fecf6448332a1010eac1aec,Nathaniel Fickel,5fecf6448332a1010eac1aec,18/Dec/24 5:01 PM,16/Jul/25 10:38 AM,,,Mobilitas 2025.08.08,,,,,,,0,"*Problem Statement*

Currently, we’re using an older version of the SurePath Structured Logger framework as it was originally implemented a number of releases ago. This has presented some challenges recently, such as a disconnect with DataDog when the logs are written, leading to additional details missing from the logs when searched. This also leads to problems around Cloud Assurance where the SurePath is being flagged as out of compliance

Resolving the current issue will allow us to provide more details in the DataDog logs which will help Operations triage potential issues more quickly, which will then reduce impact in Production as issues are more quickly brought to resolution. We will also be able to reduce the amount of Cloud Assurance findings that we are responsible for as we will be utilizing the most recent and supported SurePath, making any sort of issues/findings the responsibility of GW rather than us.
* Latest version of logging SurePath for Mammoth should be consumed from the marketplace.
* Datadog should be validated to ensure that all parameters defined are appearing in the logs after the consumption of the new SurePath version.
* Validation needs to be done for at least one instance where current debugWithMethodRef is utilized post consumption.

* Validation does not need to be done for every logged statement, but validation for each logging level should be done on the application server – ie, info, debug – to ensure that data is being logged appropriately post consumption.

* Validation against TC should be done to ensure that all Cloud Assurance findings for Structured Logger have been resolved with this consumption. See below for list of current findings against ClaimCenter. If, after consuming the latest SurePath, the Cloud Assurance scans are still showing one or more failures, please contact Sabra to have her open an exception with Guidewire.

column1: [AWS] Update SSM Parameters and Secret Manager - Assure Sign,SRNGR-921,1341293,Story,Done,SRNGR,SAFe Mobi Rangers,software,Michael Holian,5b9bf4b47037cf2ba45ce34c,,Medium,Done,Francis Eppinger,5bd8e0734b76d050e297026e,Francis Eppinger,5bd8e0734b76d050e297026e,Francis Eppinger,5bd8e0734b76d050e297026e,22/Apr/25 8:32 AM,08/Jul/25 1:52 PM,17/Jul/25 5:56 PM,08/Jul/25 1:52 PM,Mobilitas 2025.08.08,,,,,,,0,"As a Software Engineer, I want to update the SSM/Secrets parameters to be environment-specific and refactor the code to dynamically reference these parameters, so that we are ensuring consistent and secure parameter management across all environments.
Currently, our AWS stack uses account-specific SSM and secrets parameters. This approach is causing issues with parameter management and scalability across different environments.

To address this, we need to update the following SSM/Secrets to be environment-specific instead of account-specific. Additionally, we need to update the code segments that reference these parameters and tear down the now unused account-specific SSM/Secrets. Finally, we must test all impacted systems to ensure they function correctly with the new environment-specific parameters.
*WHEN* I check the SSM/Secrets parameters identified above
*THEN* I see that each environment has its own set of parameters with the correct values.
*WHEN* I search for the account-specific SSM/Secrets parameters,
*THEN* I will not find any of the previously used account-specific parameters.

*THEN* all tests will pass, and the systems will function correctly (as before) with the new parameters.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.approvals.internal.customfield.ApprovalsCFValue@6531f4b3,,,,,,,,,,,,,,No UAT,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,https://csaaig.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/MO/pages/4420010094/SRNGR-921+-+E-Sign+Parameter+Updates+Release+Notes,,,,,,"{pullrequest={dataType=pullrequest, state=MERGED, stateCount=3}, json={""cachedValue"":{""errors"":[],""summary"":{""pullrequest"":{""overall"":{""count"":3,""lastUpdated"":""2025-07-01T12:04:56.000-0700"",""stateCount"":3,""state"":""MERGED"",""dataType"":""pullrequest"",""open"":false},""byInstanceType"":{""GitHub"":{""count"":3,""name"":""GitHub""}}}}},""isStale"":true}}",True,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,"Enter the following information in the Description

column1: [Policy Change Automation] Ability to process policy changes by vehicle effective date grouping,MOBPXD-988,1374973,Story,Done,MOBPXD,Mobi Super Product,software,Crystal Chapman,712020:2305961c-4962-4646-9b4b-a0320002081b,,Not Set,Done,Danelle Marquez,557058:0e9eb854-a8cc-4eda-9585-511d70b9204c,Danelle Marquez,557058:0e9eb854-a8cc-4eda-9585-511d70b9204c,Danelle Marquez,557058:0e9eb854-a8cc-4eda-9585-511d70b9204c,02/Jun/25 5:13 PM,17/Jul/25 1:48 PM,,17/Jul/25 1:48 PM,Mobilitas 2025.08.08,,,,,,,0,"As a state product manager, I would like to automate the ability to process policy changes based on the effective date provided in the template.
* Ability to setup a batch process for automated policy changes.
** Batch should run daily and process all files in the S3 folder.
** {color:#36b37e}Batch should run every day at 12 pm and 7 pm. [Follow time zone as other batch runs]{color}
* Ability to setup an automated super user profile with necessary permissions to perform these policy changes.
* Ability to systematically create individual policy changes for each effective date, as identified in the file.
** For example, if there are 5 different effective dates in the file, the system will automate 5 different policy changes.
** Policy changes will be processed in sequential order and will follow a synchronous process flow.
*** If a policy change fails, the other pending files/policy changes will not be processed until the failed transaction is handled manually.
**** The remaining, unprocessed files will be processed during the next batch.
*** The effective date entered into the column will be used as the policy change [transaction] effective date and sent to ALIRts [existing behavior].
**** This effective date will be sent to ALIRtS as the,
***** Vehicle effective date for vehicle adds = Coverage Effective Date in ALIRtS
***** Vehicle expiration date for vehicle deletes = Vehicle Cancellation Effective Date in ALIRtS
***** Effective date for vehicle updates - for updates, do we send a date?
** {color:#36b37e}In the case of 2- year term policies, the same vehicles could be added to more than one policy - need to ensure we are not failing an import file as duplicate.{color}
* Ability to skip vehicle entries that fail due to import failures, such as duplicate VIN, and continue to process the policy change.
** If a vehicle results in a duplicate VIN, this vehicle will not be added again.
*** Duplicate VIN, Missing Year/Make/Model/VIN, Effective Date outside of policy term
** Ability to create an email notification confirming policy changes were successful.
*** When - A given file has been processed as a whole
**** Subject Line: Automated policy change(s) for vehicle updates was successful.
**** Body:{color:#ff5630} {color}{color:#36b37e}The following{color} policy changes have processed successfully for [file name]. Policy change transaction #'s - [List all transaction numbers]
** Ability to create an email notification when a policy change fails to quote/bind.
*** When - A policy change cannot be quoted or bound.
**** Subject Line: An automated policy change failed to quote or bind.

**** Body: The following policy change{color:#36b37e}s{color} - [Transaction #] - {color:#36b37e}for [Policy #],{color} could not be quoted or bound during the automated process. Please review and resolve. {color:#36b37e}Note: All remaining policy changes will continue to be processed.{color}
*** Ability to create an email notification when a vehicle is skipped during the import process due to an import error [such as, Duplicate VIN].
**** When - Once all policy changes have been processed for a given file, this email will be sent containing all skipped vehicles.
***** Subject Line: Exception report for [Policy number], [File name]
***** Body: The following vehicles were skipped during import: [List [Vehicle VIN] and [Reason for failure] for each vehicle on separate lines.]
* Ability to default the Description for these policy changes and render the same within the Open Policy Transactions and Completed Policy Transactions tables on Policy Summary.
* Policy Changes condition, ability to automatically default the content in the required fields
** Changes field default - Automated vehicle changes
** Coverage Parts Affected field default - Vehicle updates to add, update, delete via automated policy change.
** Note: The fields can vary for some states.
* Ability to automatically approve any UW issues that fire, which are approvable.
*** Too many claims found for automated retrieve
* Split 2,500 total vehicles across 5 different effective dates.
** For effective dates, ensure to account for effective dates that would result in OOSE, based on the types of transactions already processed on the policy.
GIVEN: Super user (policychange_daemon) with special permission performs the automated policy changes
WHEN: Daily Batch job is processed for automated policy changes
THEN: Batch files should be available in S3 folder
AND: Batch job should be executed every 'X' hour (TBD)
GIVEN a vehicle file has 5 different effective dates
AND those effective dates include vehicle adds, updates, and deletes
WHEN the file is in process
THEN a policy change should be systematically processed for each effective date in sequential order
AND the policy change description should be defaulted to Automated vehicle changes
AND the Policy Changes condition should be prefilled with defaulted content [as seen in the story description]
AND all approvable UW issues should be systematically approved
AND each policy change is quoted and issued
AND an activity and email notification are created once all policy changes for the file have been processed

The data validation for valid values in the columns Registration state, Vehicle Type, Color Code, Registration Plate type is handled only by the Input validation in the Input template.
Once saved as csv close and re-opened or if an existing processed csv is copied and opened, the input validation might not be present. This is as per capabilities of standard csv.

Since it is an overhead to catch for valid dropdown value validation in the Batch process, It is recommended and decided to always work from the template which has the input validation. Not using the correct template and having invalid data can cause vehicle not getting imported or the missed vehicles not getting reported.
